parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma1
</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.04

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Markers

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Get marker direction.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[Number]] <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> '''markerDir''' markerName

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> markerName: [[String]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Number]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_mPos = '''markerDir''' "markerOne"</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[setMarkerDir]], [[setMarkerDirLocal]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on April 18, 2010 - 13:44 CET</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Inkompetent|Inkompetent]]<dd class="note">The direction of the marker is the same as displayed in the editor, so it can both be negative, and be 360 degrees or greater.
<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment>
